title: All the Rage (Rhonda Vincent album)
text:
All the Rage is the twentieth album by <a href="country%20music">country</a> and <a href="Bluegrass%20music">bluegrass</a> singer <a href="Rhonda%20Vincent">Rhonda Vincent</a>. It is Vincent's third live release and her second (following 2005 album "Ragin' Live") to give her backing band The Rage star billing alongside her. Released on November 11, 2016 by Vincent's own record label Upper Management Music, "All the Rage" reached number one on the <a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">Billboard</a> <a href="Top%20Bluegrass%20Albums">Top Bluegrass Albums</a> chart, her seventh album to do so. It was recorded at <a href="Bethel%20University%20%28Tennessee%29">Bethel University</a> in <a href="McKenzie%2C%20Tennessee">McKenzie, Tennessee</a>.
The album won Vincent her first <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Best%20Bluegrass%20Album">Grammy Award for Best Bluegrass Album</a> at the <a href="60th%20Annual%20Grammy%20Awards">60th Annual Grammy Awards</a> following six previous nominations as well as the first win for all five members of The Rage (following their one previous nomination for "Ragin' Live"). In a first for the Best Bluegrass Album category, "All the Rage" tied with "Laws of Gravity" by <a href="The%20Infamous%20Stringdusters">The Infamous Stringdusters</a> for the most votes, with both acts receiving Grammys.
Credits.
Courtesy of <a href="Discogs">Discogs</a>.
The Rage
